pageContext.claim: “These policies lead to the release of illegal aliens into our communities after they've been apprehended. But we're not releasing anymore. Big change, as of a couple of days ago. We're going to no longer release. We're going to catch; we're not going to release. They're going to stay with us until the deportation hearing or the asylum hearing takes place. So we're not releasing them into the community.”
pageContext.analysis: Despite Trump's tough rhetoric, asylum-seekers are still being released because the U.S. government has nowhere to house all of them pending their immigration hearings.
